snippet: Adrian Schoolcraft, a New York police officer concerned about crimes that were lost in the department’s statistics, was taken forcibly to a psychiatric ward in 2009. He has since filed a lawsuit.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on odyssey of Adrian Schoolcraft, a New York City police officer who attempted to prove that the 81st Precinct purposely made it hard for citizens to report serious crimes in an effort to manipulate crime statistics; efforts to silence Schoolcraft, who has since been vindicated, included forced psychiatric hospitalization and a prolonged suspension.
lead_paragraph: Adrian Schoolcraft, a New York police officer concerned about crimes that were lost in the department’s statistics, was taken forcibly to a psychiatric ward in 2009. He has since filed a lawsuit.

headline.seo: Officer Sues, Claiming Police Retaliation for Truth-Telling
